channel.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
channel.description:
I just completed the switch tonight, about 10 minutes ago and I don't see any problems. If anyone catches any unexpected behavior or anything out of the ordinary anywhere on the website please let me know by posting here or through a PM ASAP.
Thanks.

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:17, topic:283966”]the only thing ive noticed is that if i make a post, its marked as unread
didnt happen before
i cant see why that would be related to this though[/quote]

I’ve noticed that too, but didn’t really remember how it worked before and, like you, can’t see how it would be related to the web server.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:15, topic:283966”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=375298.msg2828848#msg2828848 date=1245246116]

Why does moparisthebest.org redirect to .com now??? This pisses me off.

I’ve decided to force those two URLs so that search engines don’t have multiple copies of everything on the site. It makes it better for everyone.[/quote]

Then please redirect moparisthebest.com to www.moparisthebest.com or fix the cookies so we don’t have to login 4 times due to someone else not using www.[/quote]

By ‘those urls’ I mean that at moparscape everyone is forced to use www.moparisthebest.com, and here everyone is forced to use www.moparisthebest.com so I am one step ahead of you.

But also the cookies have been cross-subdomain for quite a while now.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:283966”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=375298.msg2828621#msg2828621 date=1245220849]
Why does moparisthebest.org redirect to .com now??? This pisses me off.
[/quote]

I’ve decided to force those two URLs so that search engines don’t have multiple copies of everything on the site. It makes it better for everyone.[/quote]

Then please redirect moparisthebest.com to www.moparisthebest.com or fix the cookies so we don’t have to login 4 times due to someone else not using www.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Also I am running 10 php-fcgi child processes, each has their own bytecode cache of 128mb in memory. That eats up 1280mb of RAM right there.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

not really any other point… just stating that it can run with just 7mb ram if you had less than 100 users.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:11, topic:283966”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=375298.msg2829720#msg2829720 date=1245293368]
As I thought, most of the RAM (almost 8GB) is cached, and so not really used, just saved for quick use in the future (so in reality, 2.2GB is used, and the rest is free, not too shabby for a 64bit OS, running lighttpd, MySQL, postfix, sshd, and all the other services required for a server):

$ free -m total used free shared buffers cached Mem: 16078 10638 5440 0 485 7894 -/+ buffers/cache: 2258 13820 Swap: 30517 0 30517

I’ve now had more time to configure and set up everything like I want it (I think!) and after adjusting to the far different, almost script-like, configuration file format I have to say I think I like it much better than apache2.

edit:
I have now taken the time to ‘tune’ the configuration and hopefully the work will result in a super-speedy web server that won’t get bogged down. Time will tell I suppose.
[/quote]
I had an ubuntu web server with LAMP using only 7MB of ram.[/quote]Yeah and your web server had over 330k users in one database along with hundreds of thousands of other posts and active users coming onto the board… no room to talk.

…Unless there was another point you had in posting that?

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:283966”]As I thought, most of the RAM (almost 8GB) is cached, and so not really used, just saved for quick use in the future (so in reality, 2.2GB is used, and the rest is free, not too shabby for a 64bit OS, running lighttpd, MySQL, postfix, sshd, and all the other services required for a server):

$ free -m total used free shared buffers cached Mem: 16078 10638 5440 0 485 7894 -/+ buffers/cache: 2258 13820 Swap: 30517 0 30517

I’ve now had more time to configure and set up everything like I want it (I think!) and after adjusting to the far different, almost script-like, configuration file format I have to say I think I like it much better than apache2.

edit:
I have now taken the time to ‘tune’ the configuration and hopefully the work will result in a super-speedy web server that won’t get bogged down. Time will tell I suppose.[/quote]
I had an ubuntu web server with LAMP using only 7MB of ram.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

As I thought, most of the RAM (almost 8GB) is cached, and so not really used, just saved for quick use in the future (so in reality, 2.2GB is used, and the rest is free, not too shabby for a 64bit OS, running lighttpd, MySQL, postfix, sshd, and all the other services required for a server):

$ free -m total used free shared buffers cached Mem: 16078 10638 5440 0 485 7894 -/+ buffers/cache: 2258 13820 Swap: 30517 0 30517

I’ve now had more time to configure and set up everything like I want it (I think!) and after adjusting to the far different, almost script-like, configuration file format I have to say I think I like it much better than apache2.

edit:
I have now taken the time to ‘tune’ the configuration and hopefully the work will result in a super-speedy web server that won’t get bogged down. Time will tell I suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

I was having a discussion with Cheese_Police a while ago of Apache vs lighttpd. It will be interesting which will function better. Moparisthebest: Could you occasionally post CPU/RAM usage (and if possible a log from when this site ran Apache).

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

runescape3dude:

Why does moparisthebest.org redirect to .com now??? This pisses me off.

I’ve decided to force those two URLs so that search engines don’t have multiple copies of everything on the site. It makes it better for everyone.

[quote=“BAsh, post:6, topic:283966”]1.3% CPU usage. overkill much?

How do you use 10Gb of 16Gb of ram?[/quote]

I don’t know, I’ll have to look into that, the whole site operated fine and with the same software on a machine with 6GB of RAM, I’m guessing a lot of it is just being cached just in case, of course some cronjobs could have been running too…

Read full topic

item.title: Apache2 to lighttpd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Can’t really tell much yet, it’s too early. It seems more responsive and the load is very good:

top - 23:38:24 up 34 days, 4:34, 2 users, load average: 0.07, 0.12, 0.10 Tasks: 90 total, 2 running, 88 sleeping, 0 stopped, 0 zombie Cpu(s): 1.3%us, 0.2%sy, 0.0%ni, 98.0%id, 0.4%wa, 0.0%hi, 0.0%si, 0.0%st Mem: 16464564k total, 10496724k used, 5967840k free, 494856k buffers Swap: 31249816k total, 0k used, 31249816k free, 7708904k cached

Read full topic
